ruleset.name: Apex Code Style Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex code style (formatting, naming conventions, code style patterns)

rule.name: VariablesMustNotShareNamesWithClasses
rule.message: Variable names must not share names with classes to avoid confusion and improve code clarity
rule.description:
Variable names should not match class names to avoid confusion. When a variable shares a name with a class, it can be unclear whether the identifier refers to the class or an instance, making the code harder to read and understand.
Version: 1.0.0

property.name: xpath
property.value: //VariableDeclaration[ VariableExpression and ( ancestor::ApexFile//UserClass[@Name = VariableExpression/@Image] or ancestor::ApexFile//UserClass[@SimpleName = VariableExpression/@Image] or ancestor::ApexFile//UserClass[@Image = VariableExpression/@Image] or ancestor::ApexFile//UserClass[lower-case(@Name) = lower-case(VariableExpression/@Image)] or ancestor::ApexFile//UserClass[lower-case(@SimpleName) = lower-case(VariableExpression/@Image)] or ancestor::ApexFile//UserClass[lower-case(@Image) = lower-case(VariableExpression/@Image)] ) ]
